segments.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
“Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosuṃ.
“Yo hi koci, āvuso, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā cattāro dhamme attani samanupassati, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: “Reverends, any monk or nun who sees four things inside themselves should conclude:
For this is what the Buddha calls decline.’

segments.pli: Rāgavepullattaṃ, dosavepullattaṃ, mohavepullattaṃ, gambhīresu kho panassa ṭhānāṭhānesu paññācakkhu na kamati.
segments.en: They have much greed, much hate, and much delusion; and their wisdom eye doesn’t go into the many deep matters.

segments.pli: Yo hi koci, āvuso, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā ime cattāro dhamme attani samanupassati, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: Any monk or nun who sees these four things inside themselves should conclude:
For this is what the Buddha calls decline.’

segments.pli: Yo hi koci, āvuso, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā cattāro dhamme attani samanupassati, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: Any monk or nun who sees four things inside themselves should conclude:
For this is what the Buddha calls non-decline.’

segments.pli: Rāgatanuttaṃ, dosatanuttaṃ, mohatanuttaṃ, gambhīresu kho panassa ṭhānāṭhānesu paññācakkhu kamati.
segments.en: Their greed, hate, and delusion grow less; and their wisdom eye goes into the many deep matters.

segments.pli: Yo hi koci, āvuso, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā ime cattāro dhamme attani samanupassati, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṃ:
segments.en: Any monk or nun who sees these four things inside themselves should conclude:
For this is what the Buddha calls non-decline.’”

suttaplex.blurb: Signs of decline: much greed, much hate, and much delusion; and wisdom doesn’t go deep.
